intro: Astronia piperi, commonly known as the Hawaiian piper, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Astronia piperi is typically found in moist, shaded areas of rainforests and is considered a rare and endemic species.
